snippet: Scientists have for the first time identified several gene mutations that they say sharply increase the chances of autism, and have found that the risk increases with the age of the parents, particularly the father.
abstract: Scientists have, for the first time, identified several gene mutations that they say sharply increase the chances that a child will develop autism; they have found further evidence that the risk increases with the age of the parents, particularly in fathers over age 35; mutations are extremely rare and together account for a tiny fraction of autism cases; findings are posted online in the journal Nature.
lead_paragraph: Scientists have for the first time identified several gene mutations that they say sharply increase the chances of autism, and have found that the risk increases with the age of the parents, particularly the father.

headline.seo: Scientists Link Rare Gene Mutations to Heightened Risk of Autism
headline.main: Scientists Link Gene Mutation to Autism Risk
